Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Disabling multi-dex throws "java.exe" exited with code 2" (#3351) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
In the recent Developer Summit, it was recommended that we turn off multi-dex. When I do that, I'm getting `"java.exe" exited with code 2`. This is all for a Xamarin.Forms project with version 4. I observed that using d8 & r8 while multi-dex is turned off fixes the problem. 

@jonathanpeppers 

- Just to clarify, should d8 & r8 be turned on in debug and release or just one environment? 
- Also, I saw that a brand new XF project does not explicitly specify d8 & r8 but disabling multi-dex works. So it looks like I lack some config somewhere.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] Problem enabling Use Fast Development" (#3335) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
cant emulate my android project when enabling `Use Fast Development`.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enable `Use Fast Development`
2. Rebuild
3. Run on my samsung s9 edge

### Expected Behavior
the app should start on the mobile
### Actual Behavior
the app start and then shutdown directly without any errors.
as for visual studio, the emulator stop
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.1.0.555618
- Last known good version: hmm dont remember really, i think 4.0.0.425677
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: 9.0
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: samsung s9 edge

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Crash while using kotlinx-couroutine " (#3348) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

We have created a binding from a AAR file that has kotlinx-couroutine as one of its dependency. While creating the binding the dependency is added as below.
    <EmbeddedReferenceJar Include="Jars\kotlinx-coroutines-android-1.1.1.jar" />

The app that uses the binding builds fine and on launch it crashes with the below exception.


[AndroidRuntime] FATAL EXCEPTION: main
[AndroidRuntime] Process: com.airwatch.xamarinsampleapp, PID: 20262
[AndroidRuntime] java.lang.IllegalStateException: Module with the Main dispatcher is missing. Add dependency providing the Main dispatcher, e.g. 'kotlinx-coroutines-android'

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Overriden resources from a control library are not resolved correctly" (#6871) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Overriden resources from a control library are not resolved correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create Xamarin.Forms iOS project
2. Add a library L1 and link it to the two projects (main project and iOS project)
3. Create resource R1 in the library and add new control/view ControlView with style S1 and  resource key K1.
4. In app.xaml resource add MergedDictionaries with reference to resource R1.
5. In the app.xaml override the same resource S1 with style S2 with resource key K1.
6. Create a new ContentView control C1 in library L1 and set its Style to StaticResource with key K1.
7. In MainPage.xaml define two controls ContentView and C1 and set its styles to StaticResource with key K1.

### Expected Behavior
MainPage should show the ContentView control with style S2 and C1 control with the style S2 - since S2 overrides S1).

### Actual Behavior
MainPage shows the ContentView control with style S2 and C1 control with style S1.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: XamarinForms 4.1.0.581479
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Stydio 2019 for Windows 
- Affected Devices: iOS (I have not tested with other devices.)

### Screenshots

Actual
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47161856/61190525-9ef3cc80-a66b-11e9-8d7e-db9994806b2d.png)

Expected
S2
S2

### Reproduction Link

[App8.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3390512/App8.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CollectionView doesn't resize on orientation change (Android) [Bug] " (#6869) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Collection view doesn't resize on orientation from Portrait to Landscape.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add CollectionView to a ContentPage (setting Horizontal and Vertical options to FillAndExpand)
2. Bind ItemsSource to a collection with items
3. Start in a simulator in Portrait
4. Rotate device to Landscape

### Expected Behavior
Contents of CollectionView resize to fill entire view

### Actual Behavior
Content doesn't resize leaving whitespace on the right.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.1.0.581479
- Last known good version: Unknown
- IDE: Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
    - Android: Android 9.0 Pie 
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:  Android Simulator - Oreo, Device Essential PH1, and others.


            <StackLayout Grid.Row="2" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand" Padding="10, 0, 10, 0">
                <CollectionView ItemsSource="{Binding SearchResults}" 
                                HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" 
                                VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand" 
                                SelectedItem="{Binding SelectedItem}"
                                SelectionMode="Single">
                    <CollectionView.Behaviors>
                        <behaviors:EventToCommandBehavior EventName="SelectionChanged" Command="{Binding SelectionChangedCommand}"/>
                    </CollectionView.Behaviors>
                    <CollectionView.ItemTemplate>
                        <DataTemplate>
                            <Grid HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand">
                                <Grid.RowDefinitions>
                                    <RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
                                    <RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
                                    <RowDefinition Height="Auto"/>
                                </Grid.RowDefinitions>
                                <Label Grid.Row="0" Text="{Binding Date, StringFormat='{0:MMMM dd, yyyy}'}" FontAttributes="Bold" FontSize="14" HorizontalOptions="CenterAndExpand"/>
                                <htmlLabel:HtmlLabel Grid.Row="1" Text="{Binding Entry}" InputTransparent="True"/>
                                <BoxView Grid.Row="2" HeightRequest="1" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" BackgroundColor="Black"/>
                            </Grid>
                            
                        </DataTemplate>
                    </CollectionView.ItemTemplate>
                </CollectionView>
              
            </StackLayout>

### Screenshots
![Screenshot_1563130033](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51512233/61188019-3dba0200-a647-11e9-90ef-ac7aa0ad38f9.png)


![Screenshot_1563130022](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51512233/61188022-49a5c400-a647-11e9-923e-c740e3649785.png)



### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[X] Allow tracking the assignment of StaticResource" (#6868) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This allows advanced tracking of SR for debugging purposes. It doesn't affects
apps running without the debugger.

See also https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.diagnostics.resourcedictionarydiagnostics



### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

/

### API Changes ###
<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 Removed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 -->
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
<!-- Describe any changes that may change how a user's app behaves or appears when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
<!-- If possible, take a screenshot of your test case before these changes were made and another screenshot after the changes were made to show possible visual changes. -->

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
<!-- Please list the steps that should be taken to properly test these changes on each relevant platform. If you were unable to test these changes yourself on any or all platforms, please let us know. Also, if you are able to attach a video of your test run, you will be our personal hero. -->

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin Forms Shell doesn't seem to implement AutomationId" (#6867) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Tested this in iOS.  As far as I can see there's no good way to perform a tap of a tab unless I use the label.  I think Shell needs to implement AutomationId.  Below is a sample of code.  Xamarin.UITest is not able to locate the element with Id of "Set1"

      <Tab AutomationId="Set1"
             Title="Settings" 
             Icon="tab_settings.png">
            <ShellContent 
                AutomationId="Set1"
                Route="SettingsTab" 
                Shell.NavBarIsVisible="false" >
                <views1:SettingsTabPage AutomationId="Set1" />
            </ShellContent>
        </Tab>

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] PushModalAsync a 2nd time crashes Xamarin Forms for MacOS" (#6866) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Call PushModalAsync to show a modal page. Close the page. Then do it again. The app will crash.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamarin Forms project from template
2. Add the Mac project to it as per document: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/platform/other/mac
3. Add a page that can be used for a modal flow and call Navigation.PushModalAsync to bring it up.
4. Run the app. Bring up the modal, close it, then bring it up again.

### Expected Behavior
Modal shows again.

### Actual Behavior

Crash and this shows up in the output...
```
2019-07-14 09:40:21.008 PushModal.Mac[4644:3412733] *** Assertion failure in -[Xamarin_Forms_Platform_MacOS_PlatformRenderer transitionFromViewController:toViewController:options:completionHandler:], /BuildRoot/Library/Caches/com.apple.xbs/Sources/AppKit/AppKit-1671.50.111/Controllers/NSViewController.m:923
2019-07-14 09:40:21.009 PushModal.Mac[4644:3412733] *** Terminating app due to uncaught exception 'NSInternalInconsistencyException', reason: 'fromViewController.view.superview must not be nil'
```
...
```
=================================================================
	Managed Stacktrace:
=================================================================
	  at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
	  at ObjCRuntime.Messaging:void_objc_msgSendSuper_IntPtr_IntPtr_UInt64_IntPtr <0x000ee>
	  at AppKit.NSViewController:TransitionFromViewController <0x0099a>
	  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.NSViewControllerExtensions:HandleAsyncAnimation <0x00312>
	  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.ModalPageTracker:PresentModalAsync <0x00932>
	  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.ModalPageTracker:PushAsync <0x00262>
	  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.PlatformNavigation:Xamarin.Forms.INavigation.PushModalAsync <0x00122>
	  at Xamarin.Forms.Internals.NavigationProxy:OnPushModal <0x001f3>
	  at NavigationImpl:<>n__1 <0x00082>
	  at <OnPushModal>d__3:MoveNext <0x00372>
	  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.AsyncTaskMethodBuilder:Start <0x0020a>
	  at NavigationImpl:OnPushModal <0x0035a>
	  at Xamarin.Forms.Internals.NavigationProxy:PushModalAsync <0x* thread #1, name = 'tid_307', queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = signal SIGSTOP
```

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.1.x
- Last known good version: 3.something
- IDE: VS for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - MacOS:  10.4
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms

### Reproduction Link
[PushModal.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3390018/PushModal.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Intellisense for bindings does not work if BindingContext is not set in Xaml" (#6865) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Intellisense for bindings does not work if BindingContext is not set in Xaml.
However if BindingContext is set in Xaml, autocompletion of binding properties from viewmodel does work.
I'd expect autocompletion to work when x:DataType is set (at page level, in xaml) even if BindingContext is only set in the code-behind, but it's not working.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. New xamarin forms app, new xaml page and its associated viewmodel.
2. Do not set the BindingContext in the xaml page.
3. Enable compiled bindings by setting x:DataType at xaml page level.
4. Try autocomplete when binding a viewmodel property.

### Expected Behavior

Autocomplete should work.

### Actual Behavior

Autocomplete does not work (unless BindingContext is set in xaml).

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: XF 4.1.0.581479
- IDE: VS 2019 16.1.6
- Platform Target Frameworks: N/A (netstandard forms project)

### Screenshots
![xaml-intellisense](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12516566/61170775-8782e980-a56e-11e9-81c6-3bed09587f08.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Objective Sharpie cannot parse Xcode project" (#6580) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run `sharpie pod init ios SpectrumKit`
2. Run `sharpie pod bind`

### Expected Behavior
Should generate bindings

### Actual Behavior
Throws an error

> Exception: System.Xml.XmlException: Data at the root level is invalid. Line 1, position 1.
  at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw (System.Exception e) [0x00027] in <f792b2bdf241490b95ff84d2fee4fc0f>:0 
  at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw (System.String res, System.String arg) [0x00029] in <f792b2bdf241490b95ff84d2fee4fc0f>:0
